tests.title: JEE Main Full Length Mock Test 1

questions.question: A particle of mass 2 kg is moving with a velocity of 3 m/s. What is its kinetic energy?
The SI unit of force is:
questions.solution: Force = mass × acceleration. SI unit is Newton (N) or kg⋅m/s²

questions.question: A body is projected vertically upward with a velocity of 20 m/s. What is the maximum height reached? (g = 10 m/s²)
questions.solution: Using v² = u² - 2gh, at maximum height v=0. 0 = (20)² - 2(10)h → h = 400/20 = 20 m

questions.question: A wire of resistance 10 Ω is stretched to double its length. What is its new resistance in Ω?
questions.solution: When length is doubled, area becomes half. R = ρL/A. New R = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 40 Ω

questions.question: The work done in moving a charge of 2 C across a potential difference of 5 V is:
questions.solution: Work done W = Q × V = 2 C × 5 V = 10 J

questions.question: Which of the following is a scalar quantity?
questions.solution: Energy has only magnitude, no direction. It is a scalar quantity.

questions.question: The angular frequency of oscillation of a simple pendulum is ω. If its length is increased by 4 times, the new angular frequency becomes:
questions.solution: ω = √(g/L). If L becomes 4L, ω' = √(g/4L) = (1/2)√(g/L) = ω/2

questions.question: A lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at 60 cm. What is the object distance in cm?
The dimension of Planck's constant is:
questions.solution: E = hν → h = E/ν = [ML²T⁻²]/[T⁻¹] = [ML²T⁻¹]

questions.question: The escape velocity from Earth's surface is approximately:
questions.solution: Escape velocity = √(2GM/R) ≈ 11.2 km/s for Earth

questions.question: A carnot engine operates between 400 K and 300 K. Its efficiency is:
A spring of spring constant 100 N/m is compressed by 0.2 m. What is the potential energy stored in J?
The de Broglie wavelength of a particle is λ. If its momentum is doubled, the new wavelength is:
questions.solution: λ = h/p. If p becomes 2p, λ' = h/2p = λ/2

questions.question: Ohm's law states the relationship between:
questions.solution: Ohm's law: V = IR relates voltage (V) to current (I) at constant resistance

questions.question: Two particles of masses m₁ and m₂ are separated by distance d. The gravitational force between them is F. If the distance is doubled, the force becomes:
questions.solution: F ∝ 1/d². If d becomes 2d, F' = F/(2²) = F/4

questions.question: A 5 kg object is lifted to a height of 10 m. What is the work done against gravity in J? (g = 10 m/s²)
The refractive index of a medium is 1.5. The speed of light in that medium is:
The unit of magnetic field is:
questions.solution: The SI unit of magnetic field (B) is Tesla (T)

questions.question: A photon has energy 4 eV. Its frequency is (h = 4.14 × 10⁻¹⁵ eV⋅s):
A car accelerates from rest to 20 m/s in 10 seconds. What is its acceleration in m/s²?
What is the atomic number of Carbon?
questions.solution: Carbon has 6 protons, so its atomic number is 6

questions.question: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CHO is:
questions.solution: CHO is aldehyde group. 3 carbon chain with aldehyde = Propanal

questions.question: The hybridization of carbon in diamond is:
questions.solution: In diamond, each carbon forms 4 sigma bonds with tetrahedral geometry = sp³ hybridization

questions.question: Calculate the molecular mass of H₂O in g/mol (H=1, O=16):
questions.solution: Molecular mass = 2(1) + 1(16) = 2 + 16 = 18 g/mol

questions.question: Which of the following is a Lewis acid?
questions.solution: BF₃ is electron deficient and can accept electron pairs, hence Lewis acid

questions.question: The pH of pure water at 25°C is:
questions.solution: Pure water is neutral with pH = 7 at 25°C

questions.question: The element with electronic configuration [Ar]3d¹⁰4s²4p⁵ is:
questions.solution: [Ar] = 18 electrons, 3d¹⁰ = 10, 4s² = 2, 4p⁵ = 5. Total = 18+10+2+5 = 35 = Bromine

questions.question: How many moles of NaCl are present in 117 g of NaCl? (Na=23, Cl=35.5)
questions.solution: Molar mass of NaCl = 23 + 35.5 = 58.5 g/mol. Moles = 117/58.5 = 2 moles

questions.question: The shape of SF₆ molecule is:
questions.solution: SF₆ has 6 bond pairs and 0 lone pairs = Octahedral geometry

questions.question: Which gas is known as laughing gas?
questions.solution: Nitrous oxide (N₂O) is commonly called laughing gas

questions.question: The oxidation state of Cr in K₂Cr₂O₇ is:
What is the number of neutrons in ³⁵Cl isotope? (Atomic number of Cl = 17)
questions.solution: Number of neutrons = Mass number - Atomic number = 35 - 17 = 18

questions.question: Which of the following is an exothermic process?
questions.solution: Freezing releases heat as liquid converts to solid. It is exothermic.

questions.question: The functional group present in alcohols is:
questions.solution: Alcohols contain hydroxyl group (-OH)

questions.question: According to Le Chatelier's principle, increase in pressure favors:
options: Side with fewer moles of gas
Side with more moles of gas
questions.correctAnswer: Side with fewer moles of gas
questions.solution: Increasing pressure shifts equilibrium toward side with fewer gas molecules

questions.question: If 2 moles of H₂ react with 1 mole of O₂ to form H₂O, how many moles of H₂O are formed?
questions.solution: 2H₂ + O₂ → 2H₂O. From stoichiometry, 2 moles of H₂O are formed

questions.question: The bond angle in NH₃ is approximately:
questions.solution: NH₃ has trigonal pyramidal shape with bond angle ≈ 107° due to lone pair repulsion

questions.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
questions.solution: Argon (Ar) is a noble gas in Group 18

questions.question: The crystal field stabilization energy (CFSE) is maximum for:
questions.solution: In strong field, d⁶ gives maximum CFSE with configuration t₂g⁶

questions.question: What is the normality of 1 M H₂SO₄ solution?
questions.solution: Normality = Molarity × n-factor. For H₂SO₄, n = 2. N = 1 × 2 = 2 N

questions.question: What is the value of sin(90°)?
The derivative of x³ with respect to x is:
questions.solution: d/dx(x³) = 3x³⁻¹ = 3x²

questions.question: The integral of 1/x dx is:
questions.solution: ∫(1/x)dx = ln|x| + C

questions.question: Find the value of log₂(8):
questions.solution: log₂(8) = log₂(2³) = 3

questions.question: The roots of the equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 are:
What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
questions.solution: The sum of interior angles of a triangle is always 180°

questions.question: The value of lim(x→0) (sin x)/x is:
questions.solution: This is a standard limit: lim(x→0) (sin x)/x = 1

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}, how many elements are in A ∪ B?
questions.solution: A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4}. Number of elements = 4

questions.question: The area of a circle with radius 7 cm is:
questions.solution: Area = πr² = π(7)² = 49π cm²

questions.question: What is the value of π approximately?
The determinant of matrix [[2, 3], [1, 4]] is:
What is the slope of the line 2x + 3y = 6?
The number of ways to arrange 5 distinct objects is:
questions.solution: Number of arrangements = 5! = 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1 = 120

questions.question: What is 25% of 200?
The coefficient of x² in the expansion of (1 + x)⁵ is:
questions.solution: Using binomial theorem: ⁵C₂ = 5!/(2!3!) = 10

questions.question: Find the value of 3² + 4²:
The equation of a line passing through origin with slope 2 is:
questions.solution: Line through origin: y = mx. With slope 2: y = 2x

questions.question: What is the square root of 144?
The sum of the series 1 + 2 + 3 + ... + 100 is:
If tan θ = 1, what is the value of θ in degrees (0° < θ < 90°)?
A proton and an electron are accelerated through the same potential difference. The ratio of their de Broglie wavelengths λₚ/λₑ is:
questions.solution: λ = h/√(2mqV). For same V, λ ∝ 1/√m. Therefore λₚ/λₑ = √(mₑ/mₚ)

questions.question: A satellite orbiting Earth has orbital velocity v₀. To escape Earth's gravitational field, its velocity must be increased by:
questions.solution: vₑ = √2 v₀. Additional velocity needed = √2 v₀ - v₀ = (√2 - 1)v₀

questions.question: The coefficient of mutual induction between two coils is 5 H. If current in primary changes at 10 A/s, induced emf in secondary is:
The Stefan-Boltzmann law relates radiated power to:
questions.solution: Stefan-Boltzmann law: P = σAT⁴, power is proportional to fourth power of temperature

questions.question: A ray of light passes from medium 1 (n=1.5) to medium 2 (n=1.2). The ray will:
questions.solution: Ray going from denser to rarer medium bends away from normal

questions.question: Which alkali metal has highest ionization energy?
questions.solution: Ionization energy decreases down the group. Li has smallest size, highest ionization energy

questions.question: The number of geometrical isomers for [Pt(NH₃)₂Cl₂] is:
questions.solution: Square planar complex shows cis and trans isomers = 2 geometrical isomers

questions.question: The entropy change is maximum in:
questions.solution: Liquid → Gas transition has maximum entropy change due to largest increase in disorder

questions.question: Which has maximum number of oxygen atoms?
questions.solution: 1 mole O₃ contains 3 × 6.022×10²³ = 3 moles of O atoms, maximum among given options

questions.question: The Ksp of AgCl is 1.8×10⁻¹⁰. Its solubility in water is approximately:
If α and β are roots of x² + px + q = 0, then α³ + β³ equals:
questions.solution: α³ + β³ = (α + β)³ - 3αβ(α + β) = (-p)³ - 3q(-p) = -p³ + 3pq

questions.question: The number of solutions of tan x + sec x = 2cos x in [0, 2π] is:
questions.solution: Solving: sin x + 1 = 2cos²x gives 2 solutions in [0, 2π]

questions.question: The radius of circle x² + y² - 6x + 4y - 12 = 0 is:
If vectors a and b are perpendicular, then |a + b|² equals:
questions.solution: For perpendicular vectors: |a + b|² = |a|² + |b|² + 2(a·b) = |a|² + |b|² (since a·b = 0)

questions.question: The mean of binomial distribution B(n, p) is 20 and variance is 16. The value of p is:
questions.solution: Mean = np = 20, Variance = npq = 16. Therefore q = 16/20 = 0.8, so p = 1 - 0.8 = 0.2

questions.question: A wire of length L and resistance R is stretched uniformly so that its length becomes 2L. The new resistance will be:
questions.solution: When length becomes 2L, area becomes A/2. R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R

questions.question: The magnetic field at the center of a circular coil of radius r carrying current I is B. The field at the center of another coil of radius 2r carrying current I/2 is:
questions.solution: B = μ₀I/(2r). For new coil: B' = μ₀(I/2)/(2×2r) = μ₀I/(8r) = B/8

questions.question: A satellite is revolving around earth in a circular orbit. What will happen to its kinetic energy if it moves to an orbit of larger radius?
questions.solution: KE = GMm/(2r). As r increases, KE decreases

questions.question: The dimensional formula of magnetic flux is:
questions.solution: Magnetic flux φ = BA. [B] = [MT⁻²A⁻¹], [A] = [L²]. Therefore [φ] = [ML²T⁻²A⁻¹]

questions.question: A body of mass m is projected with velocity v at angle 30° with horizontal. The angular momentum of projectile at highest point about point of projection is:
questions.solution: At highest point, v_x = v cos 30° = v√3/2. Height h = v²sin²30°/(2g) = v²/(8g). L = m(v√3/2)(v²/8g) = √3mv³/(16g) × 2 = √3mv³/(4g)

questions.question: Two identical capacitors are connected in series and then in parallel. The ratio of equivalent capacitance is:
questions.solution: Series: C_s = C/2. Parallel: C_p = 2C. Ratio = (C/2):(2C) = 1:4

questions.question: The work function of a metal is 3.5 eV. Light of wavelength 3000 Å is incident on it. The maximum kinetic energy of photoelectrons is: (h = 6.6 × 10⁻³⁴ J·s, c = 3 × 10⁸ m/s)
The ratio of intensities at two points on a screen in Young's double slit experiment is 4:1. The ratio of amplitudes at these points will be:
questions.solution: Intensity I ∝ amplitude². I₁/I₂ = (A₁/A₂)². 4/1 = (A₁/A₂)². Therefore A₁/A₂ = 2/1

questions.question: A monoatomic ideal gas undergoes an adiabatic expansion. If volume becomes 8 times, the pressure becomes:
questions.solution: For adiabatic process: PV^γ = constant. For monoatomic gas γ = 5/3. P₁V₁^(5/3) = P₂V₂^(5/3). P₂ = P₁(V₁/V₂)^(5/3) = P(1/8)^(5/3) = P/(2^5) = P/32

questions.question: A charged particle enters a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to it. The radius of circular path is r. If the energy is doubled, the radius becomes:
questions.solution: r = mv/(qB) = √(2mE)/(qB). When E becomes 2E, r' = √(2m×2E)/(qB) = √2 × √(2mE)/(qB) = √2r

questions.question: The temperature coefficient of resistance of a wire is 0.00125/°C. At 300 K its resistance is 1 Ω. The resistance at 500 K will be:
A particle moves with constant speed in a circular path. Which quantity remains constant?
questions.solution: Speed is constant, so kinetic energy KE = ½mv² remains constant. Velocity and acceleration change direction continuously

questions.question: A nucleus with mass number A = 240 breaks into two fragments A₁ = 100 and A₂ = 140. The ratio of radii R₁/R₂ is approximately:
A thin uniform rod of length L and mass M is rotating about an axis perpendicular to its length and passing through one end. Its moment of inertia is:
questions.solution: For rotation about end: I = ∫₀ᴸ (M/L)x² dx = (M/L)[x³/3]₀ᴸ = ML²/3

questions.question: The temperature at which rms velocity of oxygen molecules equals that of hydrogen molecules at 300 K is:
questions.solution: v_rms = √(3RT/M). For same v_rms: T_O₂/M_O₂ = T_H₂/M_H₂. T_O₂ = T_H₂ × M_O₂/M_H₂ = 300 × 32/2 = 4800 K

questions.question: A ray of light travels from a denser to a rarer medium. The critical angle is C. The maximum possible deviation is:
questions.solution: At critical angle, deviation δ = π - 2C

questions.question: The de Broglie wavelength associated with an electron accelerated through a potential difference of 100 V is approximately:
A particle executing SHM has amplitude A. At what displacement from mean position is its kinetic energy equal to potential energy?
questions.solution: At equilibrium: KE = ½kA². At displacement x: KE = ½k(A² - x²), PE = ½kx². For KE = PE: A² - x² = x². 2x² = A². x = A/√2

questions.question: A wire of resistance 4Ω is stretched to twice its length. Its new resistance will be:
questions.solution: When length doubles, area becomes half. R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 16Ω

questions.question: The SI unit of electric field intensity is:
questions.solution: Electric field E = Force/Charge. Unit = Newton/Coulomb = N/C or V/m

questions.question: A current of 2A flows through a wire of cross-sectional area 10⁻⁶ m². If the electron density is 10²⁹ m⁻³, the drift velocity is:
A parallel plate capacitor with air as dielectric has capacitance C. When half the space is filled with dielectric constant k, the capacitance becomes:
questions.solution: Two capacitors in series: C₁ = kC₀/2 (with dielectric), C₂ = C₀/2 (air). 1/C_eq = 2/(kC₀) + 2/C₀. C_eq = 2kC/(k+1)

questions.question: The half-life of a radioactive substance is 5 years. The fraction remaining after 15 years is:
questions.solution: n = t/t₁/₂ = 15/5 = 3. Remaining fraction = (1/2)³ = 1/8

questions.question: The energy of a photon of wavelength λ is:
questions.solution: E = hν = hc/λ, where h is Planck's constant, c is speed of light

questions.question: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image twice the size of object. The object distance is:
questions.solution: m = -2 or +2. Using lens formula 1/v - 1/u = 1/f and m = v/u. For m = -2: u = 30 cm. For m = +2: u = 10 cm

questions.question: A spring of force constant k is cut into two equal parts. The force constant of each part will be:
questions.solution: Spring constant k ∝ 1/L. When length becomes L/2, k' = 2k

questions.question: The ratio of magnetic field at the center to that at a point on axis at distance equal to radius of coil is:
questions.solution: B_center = μ₀I/(2R). B_axis = μ₀IR²/(2(R²+R²)^(3/2)) = μ₀I/(4√2R). Ratio = 2√2:1

questions.question: The impedance of an AC circuit containing only a pure inductor of inductance L at frequency f is:
questions.solution: Inductive reactance X_L = ωL = 2πfL. For pure inductor, impedance Z = X_L = 2πfL

questions.question: A body of mass 5 kg is thrown vertically upward with a velocity of 20 m/s. What is the maximum height reached? (g = 10 m/s²)
A wire of length 2 m and resistance 10 Ω is connected to a battery of EMF 12 V and internal resistance 2 Ω. Find the power dissipated in the wire (in watts).
questions.solution: Total resistance = 10 + 2 = 12 Ω. Current I = 12/12 = 1 A. Power in wire = I²R = 1² × 10 = 10 W

questions.question: A car moving with speed 72 km/h is brought to rest in 10 seconds. Find the retardation in m/s².
questions.solution: v = 72 km/h = 20 m/s. a = (v - u)/t = (0 - 20)/10 = -2 m/s². Retardation = 2 m/s²

questions.question: The kinetic energy of a body of mass 4 kg moving with speed 5 m/s is (in Joules):
questions.solution: KE = ½mv² = ½ × 4 × 5² = 50 J

questions.question: A capacitor of 2 μF is charged to 100 V. Find the energy stored in the capacitor (in millijoules).
A coil of 100 turns has area 0.1 m² and is placed in a magnetic field of 0.5 T. If the field is reduced to zero in 0.1 s, find the induced EMF (in volts).
The oxidation state of chromium in K₂Cr₂O₇ is:
Which of the following has maximum bond angle?
questions.solution: NH₄⁺ has sp³ hybridization with 4 bond pairs and no lone pairs, giving tetrahedral geometry with 109.5° bond angle

questions.question: The number of moles of NaOH required to neutralize 98 g of H₂SO₄ is:
questions.solution: Moles of H₂SO₄ = 98/98 = 1. H₂SO₄ + 2NaOH → Na₂SO₄ + 2H₂O. Required NaOH = 2 moles

questions.question: Which of the following is most acidic?
questions.solution: Order of acidity: Acetic acid > Phenol > Water > Ethanol. Acetic acid has COOH group which is most acidic

questions.question: The stability order of carbocations is:
questions.solution: Tertiary carbocations are most stable due to +I effect and hyperconjugation from three alkyl groups

questions.question: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH(CH₃)-CH₂-CH₃ is:
questions.solution: Longest chain has 4 carbons (butane). Methyl group is at position 2. Name: 2-methylbutane

questions.question: The molecular formula of benzene is:
questions.solution: Benzene has 6 carbon atoms in a ring with alternating double bonds and 6 hydrogen atoms

questions.question: Which of the following is a lewis acid?
questions.solution: BF₃ can accept an electron pair (incomplete octet on boron), making it a Lewis acid

questions.question: The rate constant of a first order reaction is 10⁻³ s⁻¹. The half-life period is:
questions.solution: For first order: t₁/₂ = 0.693/k = 0.693/(10⁻³) = 693 s

questions.question: The shape of PCl₅ molecule is:
questions.solution: PCl₅ has sp³d hybridization with 5 bond pairs and no lone pairs, giving trigonal bipyramidal geometry

questions.question: The number of electrons in Cl⁻ ion is:
questions.solution: Chlorine has 17 electrons. Cl⁻ has gained one electron, so total = 18 electrons

questions.question: Which of the following shows geometric isomerism?
questions.solution: But-2-ene (CH₃-CH=CH-CH₃) shows cis-trans isomerism due to restricted rotation around C=C bond

questions.question: The van't Hoff factor for 0.1 M Ba(NO₃)₂ solution is approximately:
questions.solution: Ba(NO₃)₂ → Ba²⁺ + 2NO₃⁻. Total ions = 3. Therefore i = 3

questions.question: Which electronic configuration represents a transition element?
questions.solution: Transition elements have partially filled d-orbitals. [Ar]3d⁵4s¹ represents chromium

questions.question: The pH of 0.01 M HCl solution is:
questions.solution: HCl is strong acid. [H⁺] = 0.01 = 10⁻². pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(10⁻²) = 2

questions.question: Freon-12 is:
questions.solution: Freon-12 (dichlorodifluoromethane) has formula CCl₂F₂, used as refrigerant

questions.question: The magnetic moment of Fe³⁺ ion (Z=26) is approximately:
questions.solution: Fe³⁺: [Ar]3d⁵. Number of unpaired electrons n = 5. μ = √(n(n+2)) = √(5×7) = √35 = 5.92 BM

questions.question: The hybridization of carbon in diamond is:
questions.solution: Each carbon in diamond forms 4 sigma bonds with tetrahedral geometry, indicating sp³ hybridization

questions.question: Which of the following is a greenhouse gas?
questions.solution: Carbon dioxide (CO₂) is a major greenhouse gas that traps heat in atmosphere

questions.question: Tollen's reagent is used to detect:
questions.solution: Tollen's reagent (ammoniacal silver nitrate) gives silver mirror test with aldehydes

questions.question: The equivalent weight of K₂Cr₂O₇ in acidic medium is: (Molecular weight = 294)
questions.solution: Cr₂O₇²⁻ + 14H⁺ + 6e⁻ → 2Cr³⁺ + 7H₂O. Change in oxidation state = 6. Eq. wt. = 294/6 = 49

questions.question: Which compound shows highest boiling point?
questions.solution: Water has highest boiling point due to strong hydrogen bonding

questions.question: The common name of ethanoic acid is:
questions.solution: Ethanoic acid (CH₃COOH) is commonly known as acetic acid (found in vinegar)

questions.question: The coordination number of Ni in [Ni(CO)₄] is:
questions.solution: In [Ni(CO)₄], four CO ligands are attached to Ni, so coordination number = 4

questions.question: For the reaction N₂ + 3H₂ → 2NH₃, if rate of disappearance of H₂ is 0.3 M/s, rate of formation of NH₃ is:
questions.solution: Rate = -d[H₂]/(3dt) = d[NH₃]/(2dt). d[NH₃]/dt = (2/3) × 0.3 = 0.2 M/s

questions.question: Which of the following is most basic?
questions.solution: Dimethylamine (CH₃)₂NH is most basic due to +I effect of two methyl groups

questions.question: Calculate the number of moles in 11 g of CO₂. (Molecular weight of CO₂ = 44)
questions.solution: Number of moles = mass/molecular weight = 11/44 = 0.25 mol

questions.question: What is the molarity of H₂SO₄ solution containing 49 g of H₂SO₄ in 500 mL of solution?
questions.solution: Moles of H₂SO₄ = 49/98 = 0.5. Volume = 500 mL = 0.5 L. Molarity = 0.5/0.5 = 1 M

questions.question: How many atoms are present in 0.5 moles of oxygen gas (O₂)?
questions.solution: 1 mole O₂ contains 6.022×10²³ molecules. Each molecule has 2 atoms. 0.5 moles = 0.5 × 2 × 6.022×10²³ = 6.022×10²³ atoms

questions.question: The oxidation state of S in H₂SO₄ is:
At what temperature will the rms velocity of oxygen be equal to that of hydrogen at 300 K? (in Kelvin)
questions.solution: v_rms ∝ √(T/M). T_O₂/T_H₂ = M_O₂/M_H₂. T_O₂ = 300 × 32/2 = 4800 K

questions.question: How many grams of NaOH are required to prepare 250 mL of 0.1 M solution? (Molecular weight of NaOH = 40)
questions.solution: Moles = Molarity × Volume(L) = 0.1 × 0.25 = 0.025. Mass = moles × molecular weight = 0.025 × 40 = 1 g

questions.question: The number of neutrons in ₁₇Cl³⁵ is:
questions.solution: Number of neutrons = Mass number - Atomic number = 35 - 17 = 18

questions.question: If α and β are roots of x² - 5x + 6 = 0, then α² + β² equals:
The value of lim(x→0) (sin x - x)/x³ is:
questions.solution: Using L'Hospital's rule three times or Taylor series: sin x = x - x³/6 + ... Therefore (sin x - x)/x³ = -1/6

questions.question: The derivative of x³ + 3x² - 5x + 7 is:
questions.solution: d/dx(x³ + 3x² - 5x + 7) = 3x² + 6x - 5

questions.question: The area of triangle with vertices (0,0), (3,0) and (0,4) is:
questions.solution: Area = ½|x₁(y₂ - y₃) + x₂(y₃ - y₁) + x₃(y₁ - y₂)| = ½|0 + 3(4) + 0| = 6

questions.question: The number of ways to arrange letters of word MATHEMATICS is:
questions.solution: MATHEMATICS has 11 letters with M-2, A-2, T-2. Arrangements = 11!/(2!×2!×2!)

questions.question: If A and B are independent events with P(A) = 0.3 and P(B) = 0.4, then P(A ∩ B) is:
questions.solution: For independent events: P(A ∩ B) = P(A) × P(B) = 0.3 × 0.4 = 0.12

questions.question: The value of sin² θ + cos² θ is:
questions.solution: This is a fundamental trigonometric identity: sin² θ + cos² θ = 1

questions.question: The equation of line passing through (2,3) and parallel to 3x + 4y = 7 is:
questions.solution: Parallel lines have same slope. Equation: 3x + 4y = k. Passing through (2,3): 3(2) + 4(3) = 6 + 12 = 18

questions.question: The sum of first n natural numbers is 210. The value of n is:
The value of ∫(1/x)dx is:
questions.solution: Integration of 1/x is ln|x| + C or log|x| + C

questions.question: The distance between points (3,4) and (0,0) is:
The coefficient of x² in expansion of (1 + x)⁵ is:
questions.solution: Using binomial theorem: ⁵C₂ = 5!/(2!×3!) = 10

questions.question: If |a| = 3, |b| = 4 and angle between them is 60°, then |a × b| equals:
The range of function f(x) = sin x is:
questions.solution: The sine function oscillates between -1 and 1 inclusive

questions.question: The value of log₁₀ 1000 is:
questions.solution: log₁₀ 1000 = log₁₀ 10³ = 3

questions.question: The equation x² + y² - 4x - 6y + 9 = 0 represents a circle with radius:
questions.solution: Rewriting: (x-2)² + (y-3)² = 4. Therefore radius = √4 = 2

questions.question: The number of diagonals in a polygon of n sides is:
questions.solution: Total line segments = ⁿC₂ = n(n-1)/2. Sides = n. Diagonals = n(n-1)/2 - n = n(n-3)/2

questions.question: The sum of an infinite GP with first term a and common ratio r (|r| < 1) is:
questions.solution: Sum of infinite GP = a/(1-r) when |r| < 1

questions.question: The value of tan 45° is:
The solution of differential equation dy/dx = y is:
questions.solution: dy/y = dx. Integrating: ln|y| = x + C'. y = e^(x+C') = Ce^x

questions.question: The derivative of tan⁻¹ x with respect to x is:
questions.solution: d/dx(tan⁻¹ x) = 1/(1+x²)

questions.question: If A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {3, 4}, then A ∪ B equals:
questions.solution: Union of sets contains all elements from both sets: A ∪ B = {1, 2, 3, 4}

questions.question: The slope of line 3x + 4y = 12 is:
questions.solution: Rewriting as y = -3x/4 + 3. Slope m = -3/4

questions.question: The eccentricity of a parabola is:
questions.solution: For a parabola, eccentricity e = 1 (distance from focus = distance from directrix)

questions.question: The value of ⁿC₀ + ⁿC₁ + ⁿC₂ + ... + ⁿCₙ is:
questions.solution: Using binomial theorem: (1+1)ⁿ = ⁿC₀ + ⁿC₁ + ... + ⁿCₙ = 2ⁿ

questions.question: The area under curve y = x² from x = 0 to x = 2 is:
questions.solution: Area = ∫₀² x² dx = [x³/3]₀² = 8/3

questions.question: The value of i² (where i = √-1) is:
questions.solution: i = √-1, therefore i² = -1

questions.question: Find the value of 5! (5 factorial).
The sum of first 10 terms of arithmetic progression 2, 5, 8, 11, ... is:
If f(x) = 2x + 3, find f(5).
The value of √144 is:
A box contains 3 red and 5 black balls. Two balls are drawn. Find the probability that both are red (answer as decimal, rounded to 2 places).
questions.solution: P(both red) = (³C₂)/(⁸C₂) = 3/28 ≈ 0.11

questions.question: The number of ways to select 3 students from 10 students is:

A particle of mass 'm' is moving in a circular path of constant radius 'r' such that its centripetal acceleration varies with time as ac = k²rt², where k is a constant. The power delivered to the particle by the force acting on it is:
questions.solution: Centripetal force F = mac = mk²rt². Velocity v = √(acr) = krt. Power P = F·v = mk²rt² × krt = mk³r²t³. However, considering the tangential component, P = mk²r²t³.

questions.question: A metal rod of length 2m is rotated with a frequency of 50 Hz, with one end hinged at the center and other end at the circumference of a circular metallic ring of radius 2m, about an axis passing through the center and perpendicular to the plane of the ring. A constant uniform magnetic field of 1T parallel to the axis is present. Find the emf (in volts) induced between the center and the metallic ring.

Two identical charged spheres suspended from a common point by two massless strings of length l are initially at a distance d (d << l) apart because of their mutual repulsion. The charge begins to leak from both the spheres at a constant rate. As a result, the spheres approach each other with a velocity v. Then v varies as a function of distance x between them as:
questions.solution: Using energy conservation and charge leakage rate, the velocity varies inversely with square root of separation, v ∝ x^(-1/2).

questions.question: The stopping potential for photoelectrons emitted from a surface illuminated by light of wavelength 400 nm is 1.2 V. Calculate the work function (in eV) of the material. (h = 6.63 × 10⁻³⁴ Js, c = 3 × 10⁸ m/s, e = 1.6 × 10⁻¹⁹ C)
questions.solution: Energy of photon E = hc/λ = (6.63×10⁻³⁴ × 3×10⁸)/(400×10⁻⁹) = 4.97×10⁻¹⁹ J = 3.1 eV. Work function φ = E - eV₀ = 3.1 - 1.2 = 1.9 eV.

questions.question: A ring of radius R is made of a thin wire of material of density ρ, having cross-section area A and Young's modulus Y. The ring rotates about an axis perpendicular to its plane through center with angular velocity ω. The tension developed in the ring is:
questions.solution: For a rotating ring, tension T = mω²R where m = ρAR. Therefore, T = ρAR × ω²R = ρAR²ω².

questions.question: In the reaction: 3Br₂ + 6CO₃²⁻ + 3H₂O → 5Br⁻ + BrO₃⁻ + 6HCO₃⁻, the equivalent weight of Br₂ is (M = molecular weight of Br₂):
questions.solution: In this disproportionation reaction, 3 moles of Br₂ gain 5 electrons and lose 1 electron (net 5 electrons). Equivalent weight = M/(n-factor) = M/5.

questions.question: The equilibrium constant Kp for the reaction N₂O₄(g) ⇌ 2NO₂(g) is 0.492 atm at 25°C. What is the percentage dissociation of N₂O₄ at a total pressure of 0.5 atm? (Round to nearest integer)
questions.solution: Let α be degree of dissociation. Kp = 4α²P/(1-α²) = 0.492. With P = 0.5: 0.492 = 2α²/(1-α²). Solving: α² = 0.492/(2+0.492) = 0.197. α = 0.71. Percentage = 71%.

questions.question: Which of the following complexes exhibits optical isomerism?
questions.solution: [Co(en)₃]³⁺ is an octahedral complex with bidentate ligands. It lacks a plane of symmetry and shows optical isomerism (d and l forms).

questions.question: Calculate the spin-only magnetic moment (in BM) of [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻. (Fe atomic number = 26)
questions.solution: Fe in [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻ is in +2 state: Fe²⁺ = 3d⁶. CN⁻ is a strong field ligand causing pairing. Configuration: t₂g⁶ eg⁰. No unpaired electrons, μ = 0 BM.

questions.question: The correct order of stability of carbocations is:
questions.solution: Carbocation stability increases with the number of alkyl groups due to +I effect and hyperconjugation. Tertiary > Secondary > Primary.

questions.solution: [Co(en)₃]³⁺ is an octahedral complex with bidentate ligands. It lacks a plane of symmetry and shows optical isomerism (d and l forms).

questions.question: Calculate the spin-only magnetic moment (in BM) of [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻. (Fe atomic number = 26)
questions.solution: Fe in [Fe(CN)₆]⁴⁻ is in +2 state: Fe²⁺ = 3d⁶. CN⁻ is a strong field ligand causing pairing. Configuration: t₂g⁶ eg⁰. No unpaired electrons, μ = 0 BM.

questions.solution: In this disproportionation reaction, 3 moles of Br₂ gain 5 electrons and lose 1 electron (net 5 electrons). Equivalent weight = M/(n-factor) = M/5.

questions.question: The number of solutions of the equation tan⁻¹(2x) + tan⁻¹(3x) = π/4 is:
questions.solution: Using tan⁻¹a + tan⁻¹b = tan⁻¹[(a+b)/(1-ab)], we get (5x)/(1-6x²) = 1. This gives 6x² + 5x - 1 = 0. Only one positive solution exists in the valid domain.

questions.question: If the coefficient of x⁷ in (ax² + 1/bx)¹¹ equals the coefficient of x⁻⁷ in (ax - 1/bx²)¹¹, then find the value of ab.
questions.solution: Coefficient of x⁷ in first expansion = ¹¹C₂·a²·b⁻⁹. Coefficient of x⁻⁷ in second = ¹¹C₉·a⁹·b⁻². Equating and simplifying gives ab = 1.

questions.question: The area bounded by the curves y = |x-1| and y = 3-|x| is:
questions.solution: The curves intersect at x = -1 and x = 2. Setting up integrals from -1 to 1 and 1 to 2, the total area = ∫(-1 to 2) [(3-|x|) - |x-1|]dx = 4 sq units.

questions.question: Find the value of k for which the lines (x-1)/2 = (y-2)/3 = (z-3)/k and (x-2)/3 = (y-3)/k = (z-1)/2 are coplanar.
questions.solution: For coplanar lines, |(x₂-x₁, y₂-y₁, z₂-z₁)·(b₁×b₂)| = 0. Setting up the determinant with direction ratios [2,3,k] and [3,k,2], and points (1,2,3) and (2,3,1), we get k² - 100 = 0, k = 10.

questions.question: The number of integral values of 'a' for which the quadratic equation x² + ax + a + 1 = 0 has integral roots is:
questions.solution: If roots are integers p and q, then p+q = -a and pq = a+1. This gives pq + p + q + 1 = 0, or (p+1)(q+1) = 0. Testing integer pairs: (0,-1), (-1,0), giving a = -1 or a = 0. Also (-2,1) gives a = 1, (1,-2) gives a = 1. Total 4 values.

questions.question: If the coefficient of x⁷ in (ax² + 1/bx)¹¹ equals the coefficient of x⁻⁷ in (ax - 1/bx²)¹¹, then find the value of ab.
questions.solution: Coefficient of x⁷ in first expansion = ¹¹C₂·a²·b⁻⁹. Coefficient of x⁻⁷ in second = ¹¹C₉·a⁹·b⁻². Equating and simplifying gives ab = 1.

questions.question: The area bounded by the curves y = |x-1| and y = 3-|x| is:
questions.solution: The curves intersect at x = -1 and x = 2. Setting up integrals from -1 to 1 and 1 to 2, the total area = ∫(-1 to 2) [(3-|x|) - |x-1|]dx = 4 sq units.

questions.question: Find the value of k for which the lines (x-1)/2 = (y-2)/3 = (z-3)/k and (x-2)/3 = (y-3)/k = (z-1)/2 are coplanar.
questions.solution: For coplanar lines, |(x₂-x₁, y₂-y₁, z₂-z₁)·(b₁×b₂)| = 0. Setting up the determinant with direction ratios [2,3,k] and [3,k,2], and points (1,2,3) and (2,3,1), we get k² - 100 = 0, k = 10.

questions.question: The number of integral values of 'a' for which the quadratic equation x² + ax + a + 1 = 0 has integral roots is:
questions.solution: If roots are integers p and q, then p+q = -a and pq = a+1. This gives pq + p + q + 1 = 0, or (p+1)(q+1) = 0. Testing integer pairs: (0,-1), (-1,0), giving a = -1 or a = 0. Also (-2,1) gives a = 1, (1,-2) gives a = 1. Total 4 values.

tests.title: Physics Sectional Test 1
tests.description: Focus on Physics - Mechanics, Electrodynamics, Modern Physics

questions.question: A car moving with a velocity of 20 m/s applies brakes and comes to rest in 10 seconds. Calculate the deceleration of the car in m/s².
questions.solution: Using the equation v = u + at, where v = 0 (final velocity), u = 20 m/s (initial velocity), t = 10 s. Therefore, 0 = 20 + a(10), which gives a = -2 m/s². The magnitude of deceleration is 2 m/s².

questions.question: A body is thrown vertically upward from the ground with a velocity of 49 m/s. After how much time will it return to the ground? (Take g = 9.8 m/s²)
questions.solution: Time to reach maximum height: t = u/g = 49/9.8 = 5 seconds. Total time for upward and downward journey = 2 × 5 = 10 seconds.

questions.question: A particle moves in a circle of radius 5 cm with constant speed and time period 0.2π s. The acceleration of the particle is:
questions.solution: Angular velocity ω = 2π/T = 2π/(0.2π) = 10 rad/s. Centripetal acceleration = ω²r = (10)² × 0.05 = 5 m/s².

questions.question: A wire of length 2 m and resistance 4 Ω is stretched to double its length. What will be its new resistance in Ω?
questions.solution: When length doubles, area becomes half. R = ρL/A. New resistance R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 16 Ω.

questions.question: The SI unit of electric charge is:
questions.solution: The SI unit of electric charge is Coulomb (C), named after Charles-Augustin de Coulomb.

questions.question: Two resistors of 4 Ω and 6 Ω are connected in parallel. If a current of 5 A flows through the circuit, find the current (in A) through the 4 Ω resistor.
questions.solution: Equivalent resistance = (4×6)/(4+6) = 2.4 Ω. Voltage across parallel combination = IR = 5 × 2.4 = 12 V. Current through 4 Ω resistor = V/R = 12/4 = 3 A.

questions.question: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at a distance of 60 cm from the lens. The object distance is:
questions.solution: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u. Given f = 20 cm, v = 60 cm. Therefore, 1/20 = 1/60 - 1/u, which gives u = -30 cm. Object distance is 30 cm.

questions.question: Calculate the kinetic energy (in Joules) of a body of mass 2 kg moving with a velocity of 5 m/s.
questions.solution: Kinetic Energy = (1/2)mv² = (1/2) × 2 × 5² = 25 J.

questions.question: The de-Broglie wavelength of an electron accelerated through a potential difference of 100 V is approximately:
A spring of force constant 800 N/m is stretched by 0.05 m. The potential energy stored in the spring is:
questions.solution: Potential energy in spring = (1/2)kx² = (1/2) × 800 × (0.05)² = 1 J.

questions.question: A car moving with a velocity of 20 m/s applies brakes and comes to rest in 10 seconds. Calculate the deceleration of the car in m/s².
questions.solution: Using the equation v = u + at, where v = 0 (final velocity), u = 20 m/s (initial velocity), t = 10 s. Therefore, 0 = 20 + a(10), which gives a = -2 m/s². The magnitude of deceleration is 2 m/s².

questions.question: A body is thrown vertically upward from the ground with a velocity of 49 m/s. After how much time will it return to the ground? (Take g = 9.8 m/s²)
questions.solution: Time to reach maximum height: t = u/g = 49/9.8 = 5 seconds. Total time for upward and downward journey = 2 × 5 = 10 seconds.

questions.question: A particle moves in a circle of radius 5 cm with constant speed and time period 0.2π s. The acceleration of the particle is:
questions.solution: Angular velocity ω = 2π/T = 2π/(0.2π) = 10 rad/s. Centripetal acceleration = ω²r = (10)² × 0.05 = 5 m/s².

questions.question: A wire of length 2 m and resistance 4 Ω is stretched to double its length. What will be its new resistance in Ω?
questions.solution: When length doubles, area becomes half. R = ρL/A. New resistance R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 16 Ω.

questions.question: The SI unit of electric charge is:
questions.solution: The SI unit of electric charge is Coulomb (C), named after Charles-Augustin de Coulomb.

questions.question: Two resistors of 4 Ω and 6 Ω are connected in parallel. If a current of 5 A flows through the circuit, find the current (in A) through the 4 Ω resistor.
questions.solution: Equivalent resistance = (4×6)/(4+6) = 2.4 Ω. Voltage across parallel combination = IR = 5 × 2.4 = 12 V. Current through 4 Ω resistor = V/R = 12/4 = 3 A.

questions.question: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at a distance of 60 cm from the lens. The object distance is:
questions.solution: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u. Given f = 20 cm, v = 60 cm. Therefore, 1/20 = 1/60 - 1/u, which gives u = -30 cm. Object distance is 30 cm.

questions.question: Calculate the kinetic energy (in Joules) of a body of mass 2 kg moving with a velocity of 5 m/s.
questions.solution: Kinetic Energy = (1/2)mv² = (1/2) × 2 × 5² = 25 J.

questions.question: The de-Broglie wavelength of an electron accelerated through a potential difference of 100 V is approximately:
A spring of force constant 800 N/m is stretched by 0.05 m. The potential energy stored in the spring is:
questions.solution: Potential energy in spring = (1/2)kx² = (1/2) × 800 × (0.05)² = 1 J.

questions.question: A car moving with a velocity of 20 m/s applies brakes and comes to rest in 10 seconds. Calculate the deceleration of the car in m/s².
questions.solution: Using the equation v = u + at, where v = 0 (final velocity), u = 20 m/s (initial velocity), t = 10 s. Therefore, 0 = 20 + a(10), which gives a = -2 m/s². The magnitude of deceleration is 2 m/s².

questions.question: A body is thrown vertically upward from the ground with a velocity of 49 m/s. After how much time will it return to the ground? (Take g = 9.8 m/s²)
questions.solution: Time to reach maximum height: t = u/g = 49/9.8 = 5 seconds. Total time for upward and downward journey = 2 × 5 = 10 seconds.

questions.question: A particle moves in a circle of radius 5 cm with constant speed and time period 0.2π s. The acceleration of the particle is:
questions.solution: Angular velocity ω = 2π/T = 2π/(0.2π) = 10 rad/s. Centripetal acceleration = ω²r = (10)² × 0.05 = 5 m/s².

questions.question: A wire of length 2 m and resistance 4 Ω is stretched to double its length. What will be its new resistance in Ω?
questions.solution: When length doubles, area becomes half. R = ρL/A. New resistance R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 16 Ω.

questions.question: The SI unit of electric charge is:
questions.solution: The SI unit of electric charge is Coulomb (C), named after Charles-Augustin de Coulomb.

questions.question: Two resistors of 4 Ω and 6 Ω are connected in parallel. If a current of 5 A flows through the circuit, find the current (in A) through the 4 Ω resistor.
questions.solution: Equivalent resistance = (4×6)/(4+6) = 2.4 Ω. Voltage across parallel combination = IR = 5 × 2.4 = 12 V. Current through 4 Ω resistor = V/R = 12/4 = 3 A.

questions.solution: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u. Given f = 20 cm, v = 60 cm. Therefore, 1/20 = 1/60 - 1/u, which gives u = -30 cm. Object distance is 30 cm.

questions.solution: Using the equation v = u + at, where v = 0 (final velocity), u = 20 m/s (initial velocity), t = 10 s. Therefore, 0 = 20 + a(10), which gives a = -2 m/s². The magnitude of deceleration is 2 m/s².

questions.question: A body is thrown vertically upward from the ground with a velocity of 49 m/s. After how much time will it return to the ground? (Take g = 9.8 m/s²)
questions.solution: Time to reach maximum height: t = u/g = 49/9.8 = 5 seconds. Total time for upward and downward journey = 2 × 5 = 10 seconds.

questions.question: A particle moves in a circle of radius 5 cm with constant speed and time period 0.2π s. The acceleration of the particle is:
questions.solution: Angular velocity ω = 2π/T = 2π/(0.2π) = 10 rad/s. Centripetal acceleration = ω²r = (10)² × 0.05 = 5 m/s².

questions.question: A wire of length 2 m and resistance 4 Ω is stretched to double its length. What will be its new resistance in Ω?
questions.solution: When length doubles, area becomes half. R = ρL/A. New resistance R' = ρ(2L)/(A/2) = 4ρL/A = 4R = 16 Ω.

questions.question: The SI unit of electric charge is:
questions.solution: The SI unit of electric charge is Coulomb (C), named after Charles-Augustin de Coulomb.

questions.question: Two resistors of 4 Ω and 6 Ω are connected in parallel. If a current of 5 A flows through the circuit, find the current (in A) through the 4 Ω resistor.
questions.solution: Equivalent resistance = (4×6)/(4+6) = 2.4 Ω. Voltage across parallel combination = IR = 5 × 2.4 = 12 V. Current through 4 Ω resistor = V/R = 12/4 = 3 A.

questions.question: A convex lens of focal length 20 cm forms an image at a distance of 60 cm from the lens. The object distance is:
questions.solution: Using lens formula: 1/f = 1/v - 1/u. Given f = 20 cm, v = 60 cm. Therefore, 1/20 = 1/60 - 1/u, which gives u = -30 cm. Object distance is 30 cm.

questions.question: Calculate the kinetic energy (in Joules) of a body of mass 2 kg moving with a velocity of 5 m/s.
questions.solution: Kinetic Energy = (1/2)mv² = (1/2) × 2 × 5² = 25 J.

tests.title: Chemistry Sectional Test 1
tests.description: Focus on Chemistry - Physical, Organic, Inorganic

questions.question: The atomic number of an element represents the number of:
questions.solution: Atomic number (Z) is defined as the number of protons present in the nucleus of an atom.

questions.question: Calculate the number of moles in 22 g of CO₂ (Molecular mass of CO₂ = 44 g/mol).
questions.solution: Number of moles = Mass/Molar mass = 22/44 = 0.5 moles.

questions.question: Which of the following pairs represents isotopes?
questions.solution: Isotopes are atoms of the same element with different mass numbers. ¹²C and ¹⁴C are both carbon atoms with 6 protons but different numbers of neutrons.

questions.question: The pH of a solution with hydrogen ion concentration of 10⁻⁵ M is:
questions.solution: pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(10⁻⁵) = 5.

questions.question: What is the oxidation state of sulfur in H₂SO₄?
questions.solution: Let oxidation state of S be x. 2(+1) + x + 4(-2) = 0, which gives x = +6.

questions.question: The hybridization of carbon in diamond is:
questions.solution: In diamond, each carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with four neighboring carbon atoms in a tetrahedral arrangement, indicating sp³ hybridization.

questions.question: Calculate the mass (in grams) of 1 mole of water (H₂O). (H = 1, O = 16)
questions.solution: Molar mass of H₂O = 2(1) + 16 = 18 g/mol. Mass of 1 mole = 18 g.

questions.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
questions.solution: Argon is a noble gas belonging to Group 18 of the periodic table.

questions.question: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CH₂-OH is:
questions.solution: The compound has 3 carbons with -OH group at position 1, hence the IUPAC name is 1-Propanol or Propan-1-ol.

questions.question: Calculate the number of atoms in 0.5 moles of oxygen gas (O₂). Express your answer as × 10²³. (Avogadro number = 6.022 × 10²³)
questions.solution: Number of molecules = 0.5 × 6.022 × 10²³ = 3.011 × 10²³. Since O₂ has 2 atoms per molecule, total atoms = 2 × 3.011 × 10²³ = 6.022 × 10²³.

questions.solution: Isotopes are atoms of the same element with different mass numbers. ¹²C and ¹⁴C are both carbon atoms with 6 protons but different numbers of neutrons.

questions.question: The pH of a solution with hydrogen ion concentration of 10⁻⁵ M is:
questions.solution: pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(10⁻⁵) = 5.

questions.question: What is the oxidation state of sulfur in H₂SO₄?
questions.solution: Let oxidation state of S be x. 2(+1) + x + 4(-2) = 0, which gives x = +6.

questions.question: The hybridization of carbon in diamond is:
questions.solution: In diamond, each carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with four neighboring carbon atoms in a tetrahedral arrangement, indicating sp³ hybridization.

questions.question: Calculate the mass (in grams) of 1 mole of water (H₂O). (H = 1, O = 16)
questions.solution: Molar mass of H₂O = 2(1) + 16 = 18 g/mol. Mass of 1 mole = 18 g.

questions.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
questions.solution: Argon is a noble gas belonging to Group 18 of the periodic table.

questions.question: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CH₂-OH is:
questions.solution: The compound has 3 carbons with -OH group at position 1, hence the IUPAC name is 1-Propanol or Propan-1-ol.

questions.question: Calculate the number of atoms in 0.5 moles of oxygen gas (O₂). Express your answer as × 10²³. (Avogadro number = 6.022 × 10²³)
questions.solution: Number of molecules = 0.5 × 6.022 × 10²³ = 3.011 × 10²³. Since O₂ has 2 atoms per molecule, total atoms = 2 × 3.011 × 10²³ = 6.022 × 10²³.

questions.question: Calculate the number of atoms in 0.5 moles of oxygen gas (O₂). Express your answer as × 10²³. (Avogadro number = 6.022 × 10²³)
questions.solution: Number of molecules = 0.5 × 6.022 × 10²³ = 3.011 × 10²³. Since O₂ has 2 atoms per molecule, total atoms = 2 × 3.011 × 10²³ = 6.022 × 10²³.

questions.question: The atomic number of an element represents the number of:
questions.solution: Atomic number (Z) is defined as the number of protons present in the nucleus of an atom.

questions.question: Calculate the number of moles in 22 g of CO₂ (Molecular mass of CO₂ = 44 g/mol).
questions.solution: Number of moles = Mass/Molar mass = 22/44 = 0.5 moles.

questions.question: Which of the following pairs represents isotopes?
questions.solution: Isotopes are atoms of the same element with different mass numbers. ¹²C and ¹⁴C are both carbon atoms with 6 protons but different numbers of neutrons.

questions.question: The pH of a solution with hydrogen ion concentration of 10⁻⁵ M is:
questions.solution: pH = -log[H⁺] = -log(10⁻⁵) = 5.

questions.question: What is the oxidation state of sulfur in H₂SO₄?
questions.solution: Let oxidation state of S be x. 2(+1) + x + 4(-2) = 0, which gives x = +6.

questions.question: The hybridization of carbon in diamond is:
questions.solution: In diamond, each carbon atom forms four sigma bonds with four neighboring carbon atoms in a tetrahedral arrangement, indicating sp³ hybridization.

questions.question: Calculate the mass (in grams) of 1 mole of water (H₂O). (H = 1, O = 16)
questions.solution: Molar mass of H₂O = 2(1) + 16 = 18 g/mol. Mass of 1 mole = 18 g.

questions.question: Which of the following is a noble gas?
questions.solution: Argon is a noble gas belonging to Group 18 of the periodic table.

questions.question: The IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CH₂-OH is:
questions.solution: The compound has 3 carbons with -OH group at position 1, hence the IUPAC name is 1-Propanol or Propan-1-ol.

tests.title: Mathematics Sectional Test 1
tests.description: Focus on Mathematics - Algebra, Calculus, Coordinate Geometry

questions.question: If sin θ = 1/2, then the value of θ (0° < θ < 90°) is:
questions.solution: sin 30° = 1/2, therefore θ = 30°.

questions.question: Find the derivative of x³ with respect to x at x = 2.
questions.solution: d/dx(x³) = 3x². At x = 2, derivative = 3(2)² = 12.

questions.question: The value of lim(x→0) (sin x)/x is:
questions.solution: This is a standard limit: lim(x→0) (sin x)/x = 1.

questions.question: Solve for x: 2x + 5 = 15
questions.solution: 2x = 15 - 5 = 10, therefore x = 5.

questions.question: The sum of the first n natural numbers is given by:
questions.solution: The sum of first n natural numbers = 1 + 2 + 3 + ... + n = n(n+1)/2.

questions.question: Find the area (in square units) of a circle with radius 7 units. (Use π = 22/7)
questions.solution: Area = πr² = (22/7) × 7² = (22/7) × 49 = 154 square units.

questions.question: If log₁₀ 2 = 0.3010, then log₁₀ 20 is:
Calculate the value of 5! (5 factorial).
The number of ways to arrange the letters of the word 'MATHEMATICS' is:
questions.solution: MATHEMATICS has 11 letters with M-2, A-2, T-2 repeated. Number of arrangements = 11!/(2!×2!×2!).

questions.question: The roots of the equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 are:
questions.solution: Factoring: x² - 5x + 6 = (x-2)(x-3) = 0, therefore roots are x = 2 and x = 3.

questions.solution: This is a standard limit: lim(x→0) (sin x)/x = 1.

questions.question: Solve for x: 2x + 5 = 15
questions.solution: 2x = 15 - 5 = 10, therefore x = 5.

questions.question: The sum of the first n natural numbers is given by:
questions.solution: The sum of first n natural numbers = 1 + 2 + 3 + ... + n = n(n+1)/2.

questions.question: Find the area (in square units) of a circle with radius 7 units. (Use π = 22/7)
questions.solution: Area = πr² = (22/7) × 7² = (22/7) × 49 = 154 square units.

questions.question: If log₁₀ 2 = 0.3010, then log₁₀ 20 is:
Calculate the value of 5! (5 factorial).
The number of ways to arrange the letters of the word 'MATHEMATICS' is:
questions.solution: MATHEMATICS has 11 letters with M-2, A-2, T-2 repeated. Number of arrangements = 11!/(2!×2!×2!).

questions.question: The roots of the equation x² - 5x + 6 = 0 are:
questions.solution: Factoring: x² - 5x + 6 = (x-2)(x-3) = 0, therefore roots are x = 2 and x = 3.

questions.solution: sin 30° = 1/2, therefore θ = 30°.
